title.narrative: Support to Uruguayan Public Schools Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to improve the quality, equity and internal efficiency of primary education, through the expansionof the Full-Time School model.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article V of Section 5.02. (b) of the Loan Agreement | Description :The Project Implementing Entity, through alegal opinion satisfactory to the Bank, indicate that the Inter-Administrative Agreement, has been duly authorized or ratified by,and executed and delivered on behalf of, the Project Implementing Entity and is legally binding upon the Project ImplementingEntity in accordance with the terms of the Inter-Administrative Agreement. | Due Date :07-Mar-2013

Finance Agreement :Article V. of Section 5.01. of the Loan Agreement | Description :The Inter-Administrative Agreement has beenexecuted on behalf of the Borrower and the Project Implementing Entity. | Due Date :07-Mar-2013

Finance Agreement :Article V. of Section 5.02. (a) of the Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower, through a legal opinionsatisfactory to the Bank, indicate that the Inter-Administrative Agreement, has been duly authorized or ratified by, and executedand delivered on behalf of, the Borrower and is legally binding upon the Borrower in accordancewith the terms of theInter-Administrative Agreement. | Due Date :07-Mar-2013

Finance Agreement :Section C. of Schedule 1 of the Project Agreement | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall, andshall cause to, carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental and Social Management Framework. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.A.1. of Schedule 2 of the Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall make the proceeds of theLoan available to the Project Implementing Entity, under a subsidiary agreement betweenthe Borrower and the Project ImplementingEntity, under terms and conditions approved by the Bank (the "Inter-Administrative Agreement"). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.A.3.(a) of Schedule 1 of the Project Agreement | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shalloperate and maintain during Project implementation the PCU with a structure, functions and responsibilities satisfactory to theBank, including, inter alia, its responsibility to assist the Project Implementing Entity in the coordination and implementation ofthe Project. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.A.3.(b) of Schedule 1 of the Peoject Agreement | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shallensure that the PCU is at all the times headed by a Project coordinator and assisted by staffin adequate numbers, all withqualifications and experience acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.C. of Schedule 2 of the Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall ensure that the Project iscarried out in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental and Social Management Framework. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section V. of Schedule 2 of the Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall take all necessary actions toenable the Project Implementing Entity to comply with its obligations under the Project Agreement. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Number of preschool teachers and teachers from grades 1 and 2 that completed in-service training (APRENDER)
Number of Full-Time Schools that annually receive resources for preventive maintenance.
Number of Full-Time Schools benefiting from resources for corrective maintenance.
Number of teachers that completed in-service training courses (FTS)
Number of studies/evaluations completed under the Project.
Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Number of teachers that completed in-service training courses (APRENDER)
Number of school directors and inspectors that completed in-service training courses.
Number of Full-Time Schools that are equipped with physical and educational equipment.
Equity. Increase in the number of students enrolled in newly converted FTS schools in quintiles 1 and 2.
Number of preschool teachers and teachers from grades 1 and 2 that completed in-service training (FTS)
Equity and Internal Efficiency. Reduction in the gap in repetition rates in 1st grade between 1st and 2nd quintiles of FTS and the5th quintile of all urban schools.
Reduce Insufficient attendance of children in Grade 1 in FTS.
Creation and functioning of an entity for in-service training within CEIP.

target.value: In-Service Training courses provided directly by CEIP

actual.value: In Service Training courses provided directly by CEIP

title.narrative: Updated interface to exploit data from the Guri system.
Quality. Increase in the proportion of students enrolled in 6th grade in FTS with test scores corresponding to or higher than the National Learning Evaluations Level Two in Mathematics.
Quality. Increase in the proportion of students enrolled in 6th grade in FTS with test scores corresponding to or higher than the National Learning Evaluations Level Two in Reading.
